message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how one can arrive at (and build) the two structures exactly as shown, using only the blocks/orientations given in the “Block Dictionary” image.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
● There are two separate structures:

(A) “Giraffe‐like” Structure (left):
   – Bottom Layer: 4 orange cylinders forming “legs.”
   – Above That: A long yellow rectangular block as a “platform.”
   – Rising at the back: 1 more orange cylinder as the “neck.”
   – On Top of the Platform: 1 blue cube in the center and 3 orange wedges around it,
     creating a pitched/angled shape.
   – At the Very Top (above the “neck”): 1 yellow half‐cylinder.

   Count for Left Structure:
   – 5 orange cylinders  
   – 1 yellow rectangular block  
   – 1 blue cube  
   – 3 orange wedges  
   – 1 yellow half‐cylinder  
   → Total of 11 pieces.

(B) “House‐like” Structure (right):
   – Bottom Two Layers (4 cubes total): The first row has an orange cube (left) and a blue cube (right). The second row repeats an orange (left) and a blue (right).  
   – Next Layer: 1 green rectangular block bridging across.  
   – Top Layer (Roof): 2 orange wedges, one on each side, forming a peaked roof.

   Count for Right Structure:
   – 2 orange cubes  
   – 2 blue cubes  
   – 1 green rectangular block  
   – 2 orange wedges  
   → Total of 7 pieces.

Overall, the scene uses 18 total blocks.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Matching each shape/color/orientation from the dictionary exactly (no rotations other than what is shown):

● For the Left “Giraffe”:
   1) Five orange cylinders → Block #10 (used 5 times)  
   2) One large yellow rectangular block → Block #9  
   3) One blue cube → Block #1  
   4) Three orange wedges (each in a distinct orientation).  
      A suitable choice is to take blocks #13, #15, and #16.  
   5) One yellow half‐cylinder → Block #11  

● For the Right “House”:
   1) Two orange cubes → Block #3 (2×)  
   2) Two blue cubes → Block #1 (2×)  
   3) One green rectangular block (horizontal) → Block #6  
   4) Two orange wedges for the roof → Blocks #14 and #16  

Hence the complete block‐index list needed:

 • #1 (blue cube) ×3  (1 for the giraffe body, 2 for the house)  
 • #3 (orange cube) ×2  
 • #6 (green rectangular) ×1  
 • #9 (yellow rectangular) ×1  
 • #10 (orange cylinder) ×5  
 • #11 (yellow half‐cylinder) ×1  
 • #13 (orange wedge) ×1  
 • #14 (orange wedge) ×1  
 • #15 (orange wedge) ×1  
 • #16 (orange wedge) ×2  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one possible order in which to place or “move” each block into position.  
(Feel free to group or reorder as convenient; the key is that all pieces must be placed.)

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 10   // 1st orange cylinder (leg)
  Step2:  Move block with index 10   // 2nd orange cylinder (leg)
  Step3:  Move block with index 10   // 3rd orange cylinder (leg)
  Step4:  Move block with index 10   // 4th orange cylinder (leg)
  Step5:  Move block with index 9    // Yellow rectangular platform on top of legs
  Step6:  Move block with index 10   // 5th orange cylinder (neck)
  Step7:  Move block with index 11   // Yellow half‐cylinder (head)
  Step8:  Move block with index 1    // Blue cube (center of “body”)
  Step9:  Move block with index 13   // 1st orange wedge around blue cube
  Step10: Move block with index 15   // 2nd orange wedge around blue cube
  Step11: Move block with index 16   // 3rd orange wedge around blue cube

  // Now the “house” on the right:
  Step12: Move block with index 3    // Orange cube (bottom‐left)
  Step13: Move block with index 1    // Blue cube (bottom‐right)
  Step14: Move block with index 3    // Orange cube (second‐row left)
  Step15: Move block with index 1    // Blue cube (second‐row right)
  Step16: Move block with index 6    // Green rectangular block (middle layer)
  Step17: Move block with index 14   // Orange wedge (left side of roof)
  Step18: Move block with index 16   // Orange wedge (right side of roof)
}

That completes the two structures exactly as shown in the main image, using only the listed blocks in their given orientations.
